original_data.question: A 21-year-old college student comes to the physician because of daytime fatigue for 2 months. He has problems getting to sleep at night and frequently falls asleep during class. Recently he has started skipping classes altogether. He goes to bed between 11 p.m. and 1 a.m. but cannot fall asleep for 2–3 hours. When he wakes up at 8:30 a.m., he feels extremely drowsy, and he tries to overcome his fatigue by drinking 2–3 cups of coffee a day. He naps at various times during the afternoon, often for more than an hour. He stopped watching videos on his smartphone at night because of suggestions from his peers. He states that he has tried over-the-counter melatonin pills and exercising at 8 p.m. without success. He has no history of serious illness. He does not smoke. He drinks three to five beers on weekends. Physical examination shows no abnormalities. Which of the following is the most appropriate recommendation for this patient?

model_response:
This patient's history suggests that he has a delayed sleep phase syndrome (DSPS). This condition is frequently seen in adolescents and young adults. It is caused by a delay in the circadian rhythm, which is a 24-hour cycle that regulates many biologic functions, including the sleep-wake cycle. The pineal hormone melatonin plays an important role in the maintenance of the circadian rhythm. Individuals with DSPS have a delayed release of melatonin, which results in a delay of the circadian rhythm. They have difficulty falling asleep in the early evening and awakening in the morning. They often complain of feeling tired in the morning and sleepy in the afternoon. They may try to adjust their sleep schedule by staying up late at night and sleeping late in the morning, but this may interfere with their ability to function during the day. The diagnosis of DSPS is made by obtaining a sleep log for several days and by measuring the melatonin level in a blood sample taken in the morning. The treatment of DSPS includes a trial of diphenhydramine, which will help him fall asleep at night, and scheduled afternoon naps. He should avoid alcoholic beverages in the evening because they can disrupt sleep. He should stop evening exercise because it can delay the circadian rhythm.

Answer: OPTION D IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: An institution of higher education created to educate and grant degrees; often a part of a university.
Individuals enrolled in a school or formal educational program.
Having a black or dark core or plug.
Individuals licensed to practice medicine.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A readily reversible suspension of sensorimotor interaction with the environment, usually associated with recumbency and immobility.
The time in every 24 hour period when it is dark.
A grouping of things based on shared common attributes.
Equipment on which one may lie and sleep, especially as used to care for the hospital patient.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
Emotional sensations.
The sensation of struggling to remain awake.
Deal with successfully.
The state of weariness following a period of exertion, mental or physical, characterized by a decreased capacity for work and reduced efficiency to respond to stimuli.
Behaviors associated with the ingesting of ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES, including social drinking.
A beverage made from ground COFFEA beans (SEEDS) infused in hot water. It generally contains CAFFEINE and THEOPHYLLINE unless it is decaffeinated.
Occurring or done each day.
The time period between noon and sunset.
A unit measure of time equal to 3,600 seconds or 60 minutes. It is approximately 1/24 of a median day.
A cell phone with advanced computing and connectivity capability built on an operating system.
The time in every 24 hour period when it is dark.
The uncritical acceptance of an idea or plan of action.
Persons who are equal in one or more respects, including age, education, religion, sex, or social class.
A constituent administrative district of a nation.

A biogenic amine that is found in animals and plants. In mammals, melatonin is produced by the PINEAL GLAND. Its secretion increases in darkness and decreases during exposure to light. Melatonin is implicated in the regulation of SLEEP, mood, and REPRODUCTION. Melatonin is also an effective antioxidant.
An event that accomplishes its intended purpose.
Record and study of past events.
A state of ill health, bodily malfunction, or discomfort.
Visible gaseous suspension of carbon and other particulate matter emitted from burning substances.
A single serving of a beverage; any liquid suitable for drinking.
An alcoholic beverage usually made from malted cereal grain (as barley), flavored with hops, and brewed by slow fermentation.
The time period comprising Saturday and Sunday, and sometimes considered to include Friday night.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
